title: Payroll Specialist
content:
As a Payroll Specialist you will impact the lives of employees through your excellent customer service skills and by processing and producing accurate payroll each pay period. Our employees love to be paid timely each pay period so we work hard to make that happen. Responsible for performing payroll functions and related tasks for most, if not all Buckner corporations, including processing disbursement of payroll. Perform day-to-day payroll functions, including, but not limited to, processing new hires, transfers, terminations, leave events and performing benefits and tax procedures. Provide customer service to Buckner International employees regarding payroll matters.
What You’ll Do

Be an awesome contributor to our people operations team.
Ensure accurate and timely processing and recording of time for multi-state payroll for a 1000+ employees.
Batch and input employee pay data each pay period that is not received via workflows in ADP Vantage for all corporations as needed.
Manage the processing of bi-weekly disbursement of payroll, including garnishments, benefits, and taxes consistent with federal and state wage and hour laws.
Compile, balance, and ensure compliance requirements are met for additional earnings submissions, time corrections, and rate overrides submitted from multiple locations, validating results in payroll system.
Audit all changes entered by Field HR or HRIS staff for accuracy and compliance with Federal, State and Local laws as well as Buckner International.
Manage regular preparation of relevant management reports, including bi-weekly, monthly, quarterly and year-end reports as needed.
Communicate actively with Operations, HR, accounting, and executive management to review cross-departmental impacts and reconcile data sharing.
Process Payroll Journal Entries out of ADP after each payroll.
Assist with ensuring systems are set-up and updated to reflect our current employee base, including wages, benefits, PTO, Supplemental Bank in line with contracts and offer letters.
Research multiple sources of payroll and system data to provide resolution for payroll inquiries.

What You’ll Bring to the Team

High school diploma or GED. Associate’s degree preferred.
A minimum of 5 years of related payroll administration or HR experience including multi-state payroll processing using payroll processing software.
Prior related experience processing payroll using ADP preferred.
Requires intermediate to advanced excel skills.
Must possess current working knowledge of federal and state payroll laws and maintain current on laws in the states where each corporation operates.
Proficient working knowledge and ability to manage automated payroll processing systems, including the ability to run reports and other required financial documentation.
A strong attention to detail.
Mathematical aptitude, analysis skills and ability to communicate such verbally and in writing required.

Job PerksAt Buckner one of the ways we show value to our team members is by offering the following perks:

Medical and Dental benefits for employees and their eligible dependents;
Life insurance;
Short Term and Long Term Disability benefits;
Paid Time Off and Holidays;
Paid Parental Leave;
Retirement Savings Plan; and
The 5Star Fun Benefit: encourages employees to spread good cheer to their co-workers and others, creating a happy, healthy environment for all!

EEOThe same way we treat our employees is how we treat all applicants – with respect. Buckner is an equal opportunity employer (EEO is the law). You will be treated fairly throughout our recruiting process and without regard to race, color, religion, ​age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status in consideration for a career at Buckner.
